plugins.name: DataPocket
plugins.description:
Integrate your data feeds and eCommerce products directly into Figma


Elevating design systems with DataPocket and Figma integration

DataPocket seamlessly integrates with Figma, enabling designers to access real-time data within their design environment. This integration streamlines workflows, ensures consistency, and enhances collaboration by incorporating live data directly into design systems.

Seamless integration into any design system

Consistent and centralized data access across design projects

Real-time updates and synchronization of data within design systems


Increased efficiency in prototyping and testing with accurate, real data

Enhanced scalability and collaboration to accommodate growing design requirements

Improved decision-making through data-driven design insights


More about the Plugin:


Real Time data access 

Access real-time data from sources like WooCommerce, Shopify, and more, directly within Figma. Streamline collaboration, boost productivity, and unlock new creative possibilities with DataPocket.


DataPocket for Figma Teams

Work cross functionally with different teams/businesses without having to worry about using the correct/relevant product data. DataPocket continuously updates product data from the source so everyone has access to the most up to date data. Gone are the days of having to redo a mock up or piece of content because the wrong information was used.


Data Sources always up-to-date

DataPocket formats all Product data allowing it to be used for drag and drop on design platforms like Figma and Canva allowing teams to easily drag and drop any modifications to the product and update their designs/mockups in seconds.
plugins.tagline: Integrate your data feeds and eCommerce products directly into Figma

plugins.name: CopyCAT
plugins.description:
CopyCAT is a Figma plugin for effortlessly creating multiple variations of a design using a CSV file for data. This plugin is ideal for producing sets of similar designs with different content, such as business cards, social media posts, or product labels, or anything you want to really.


How to use:

  1. Design a template in Figma.
  2. Open the CopyCAT plugin and select the layer.
  3. Choose all the text layers you want to edit later
  4. Download the template CSV
  5. Add your data to the CSV and reupload it.
  6. Generate copies!


Watch this demo to get a better idea: https://www.loom.com/share/c99e3691aa734a35bffa5591890e410c?sid=508074d9-0c5b-4c76-aca6-d865ea25f176
plugins.tagline: A plugin to batch edit your design templates.

plugins.name: Swift Colors
plugins.description:
Swift Colors is a simple plugin for exporting color tokens to a Swift color theme.


Features


  • Map color tokens in Figma to a type-safe Swift color theme file automatically.


  • Define light and dark mode color behaviour directly from Figma, by organising your color tokens in light and dark mode palettes.


How to use


1. Prepare your file's color tokens

Organise color styles into a light and dark mode color palette in the Color Styles panel. Figma color styles can be organised in groups by prefixing the color style name with the group name.


For example: 

"Light Mode/Buttons/Primary"

"Dark Mode/Buttons/Primary"


If you don't have a dark mode color palette yet, the plugin will use the light mode palette for dark mode too.


2. Export

Export the .swift file to your Xcode project.


3. Use in Xcode

Use your color theme by calling the desired color token name in your code. 


For example:

button.backgroundColor = Buttons.primary


4. See it in action!

If you have defined both a light and dark mode color palette that contains a color style for Buttons.primary, iOS will automatically change between the two variants based on the user's preference.


Why it works


The exported theme file includes an extension on UIColor that automatically adapts to light and dark mode variants based on the current UITraitCollection.

plugins.name: UXarts: Screenshot to Design Component
plugins.description:
What can you do with Screenshot to Design Component?

Screenshot to Design Component enables users to upload screenshots of webpages or apps and, using advanced AI and CV technology, extracts meaningful design components. These components are then converted into editable Figma files, seamlessly integrating into your design workflow. It‚Äôs the ultimate solution for transforming static screenshots into fully editable design assets.


What platforms does Screenshot to Design Component support?

  1. Design Tools: Output editable files directly to Figma, with future plans to support Sketch and Adobe XD.
  2. Input Formats: Accepts standard image formats like PNG, JPG, and even screenshots taken directly from your device.
  3. Component Types: Recognizes buttons, cards, navigation bars, forms, and other common UI elements.


Is my data safe with Screenshot to Design Component?

Absolutely! Your uploaded screenshots and generated Figma files remain private and secure. All data processing happens securely, and your designs will never be shared or used for any purpose beyond your specific use case. Our commitment to privacy aligns with industry standards.


Call to Action üìû

For support issues: it@uxarts.ai


Screenshot to Design Component Capabilities

  1. Accurate Component Detection: Reliably identifies and segments UI components from screenshots.
  2. Editable Figma Files: Outputs high-quality, editable layers ready for design customization.
  3. Structure Recognition: Understands hierarchy and relationships between components, preserving layout integrity.
  4. AI-Powered Insights: Extracts clean, reusable components, reducing manual effort.
  5. Time-Saving Workflow: Turn static images into editable designs in minutes, boosting productivity.


Enjoy designing in the AI era! üòÑ

plugins.name: Tally
plugins.description:
Quickly tally stamp votes for stickys!


Select everything you want to tally up (including the stickys and stamps) and run the plugin. It will add a visual tally count to the bottom right of every sticky for everyone to see.


Notes:

  • Don't worry if the selection contains other types of components, they won't affect the tally. Just drag a big rectangle selection over the entire area and let Tally handle the rest!
  • You will need to re-select and run the plugin every time new stamps are added that you want to include in the count
  • Stamps do not need to be directly on a sticky for them to be counted. If a stamp is part of the selection, it will count towards the sticky that it's closest to

plugins.name: Oscill
plugins.description:
Transform any vector path in your Figma document into a wave with frequency, amplitude, fade in/out and more defined by you. Choose from a set of different waveforms: Sine, Triangle and Square.


1) Draw or select a vector path. (works with other shapes too).


2) Click on ‚ÄòSync‚Äô button.


3) Play.


4) Click ‚ÄòSync‚Äô again every time you select or modify a path.


-> Your generated wave will adapt to the new selected path.


5) Click on the ‚ÄòPlace‚Äô button.


-> Your shape will get the same styling as the selected object and will be placed over it.

plugins.name: blokdots
plugins.description:
blokdots is a simple to use software to build interactive hardware prototypes without a line of code.


With this plugin you can connect Figma to the blokdots app (--> download at blokdots.com), making it possible to use hardware components like sensors and buttons to control and manipulate elements right in Figma. This means it is now possible to bridge the gap between hardware and UI prototypes!


‚Äî What you can do

You can use hardware components to set the text, color, size, rotation or position of Figma layers and map the values of your sensors to the color, size, rotation or position of a layer.


‚Äî How to use the Plugin

In the blokdots app, go to ‚ÄúConnect A New Component‚Äù and select ‚ÄúFigma‚Äù to add the integration to your project.


Then run the blokdots Plugin in Figma. Select the layer you want to be able to manipulate with your hardware prototype and press the ‚ÄúExpose to blokdots‚Äù button in the Plugin window.


You can now select ‚ÄúFigma‚Äù as a component in any card in blokdots, select one of the layers you exposed and define how it should respond.


When you run your project in blokdots, make sure the blokdots plugin in Figma is running as well. blokdots and Figma will connect automatically and you can now manipulate Figma layers right from your hardware prototype!


‚Äî Requirements

To use this plugin you need to ‚Ä¶

‚Ä¢ have the latest version of the blokdots app installed and running --> download at blokdots.com

‚Ä¢ have an Arduino microcontroller set up

‚Ä¢ use the Figma Desktop version

This Figma Plugin powers the Fork Awesome Icon Set open source library. It‚Äôs an icon library designed for mobile, desktop, web and print.


There are 811 icons included in this icon library, all of which can be searched through and added to your designs.


Popular Fork Awesome Icon Set icons:

  • Tool icons
  • Logos and brands
  • Star and interface icons


Plugin features:

  • Drag and drop any icons
  • Search through them instantly
  • Click any icon to add it your design
  • View search history
  • View embed history


Coming soon:

  • Save your favorite Fork Awesome Icon Set icons

manifest.name: Fork Awesome Icon Set by Iconduck

90528.tagline: Fork Awesome Icon Set is an open source library of 811 icons. Free to use in all your designs!

plugins.name: Layer Namer
plugins.description:
Do you find layer-naming a chore? Are you tired of being called out for "sloppy" design files? This plugin gives your layers nice, human names. It renames all the layers in your selection and all their children (and descendants)


Settings

  1. Optionally choose a gender for first names
  2. Toggle last names on or off


(Current) Limitations

  1. The plugin will rename all the layers in your selection
  2. The plugin will rename layers it has already named


Contents

  1. The 100 most common surnames in the United States, according to the 2000 United States census
  2. The 100 most common male and female names in the US over the last 100 years (1922‚Äì2021)

accepted.name: Norton
accepted.description:
Electronic means, humanist ends.
Open to new UI/UX projects üå±

plugins.name: Acrolinx for Figma and FigJam
plugins.description:
Acrolinx is an AI-powered platform that eliminates content chaos and delivers strategy-aligned content, at scale.


Our technology captures the way your enterprise communicates, aligns your content with your guidelines, shortens your editorial process with automation, and analyzes the performance of your entire content operation.


Get customers faster, keep them longer, and reduce risks in communication.


As you write, the Acrolinx Sidebar guides you to create content that‚Äôs aligned with your strategy. Acrolinx ensures you‚Äôre using the words and phrases that are relevant to your company tone of voice and the audience you‚Äôre trying to reach. See where your content is strong and where it could be stronger with a detailed Acrolinx Scorecard and Analytics insights.


Acrolinx is not a stand-alone authoring tool. It‚Äôs an enterprise tool, which requires a paid existing Acrolinx account. If your company doesn‚Äôt have Acrolinx installed (or you‚Äôre not sure) we‚Äôd love to help you learn more.


Visit www.acrolinx.com to discover how you can supercharge your content.
plugins.tagline: This plugin adds the Acrolinx Sidebar to Figma and FigJam!

77223.release_notes:
In this release, we've improved how Acrolinx reads formatting for paragraphs and lists.

Improvements
More contextual information - The text content of Figma nodes now comes with more contextual information, including details about the structure of paragraphs and lists. We've updated Acrolinx to align with this and improve checking behavior. Get the updated Figma Content Profile to benefit from these changes.

https://support.acrolinx.com/hc/en-us/articles/10211389481490-Acrolinx-for-Figma-Release-Notes

plugins.name: Match Size
plugins.description:
Match Size enables you to easily make many objects in your design the same size.


How to use

  1. Install the plugin from Figma Community
  2. Select an object on your Figma design or FigJam canvas that is the desired size
  3. Open Quick Actions (Cmd ‚åò + K on Mac; Ctrl + K on Windows) and select Match Size > 1. Set
  4. Select the other object(s) that you want to match to the desired size
  5. Open Quick Actions and select Match Size > 2. Apply
plugins.tagline: Bring harmony to your diagrams and layouts

Main features of PMF by Morisawa Fonts


Use of high-quality fonts

  1. Fonts can be obtained from Morisawa's font service and converted to paths, allowing them to be reflected in designs.
  2. Professional standard typefaces and design typefaces loved by designers, such as UD Shin Go, Ryumin, and Gothic MB101, can be used.


Character attribute settings

  1. In addition to font selection, you can also adjust simple typography settings such as character spacing and proportionality
  2. It also has a vertical writing function (beta version), which supports typography for vertical videos such as reels.


Collaboration through text path creation and restoration

  1. The software is equipped with a function that converts text into paths in SVG format. It is possible to restore the text that has been converted into paths in Figma to its original state, which supports flexible design changes and sharing, and accelerates collaboration.
  2. The exported materials can also be used in other design tools and platforms.

Main features of PMF by Morisawa Fonts


Use of high-quality fonts

  1. Fonts can be obtained from Morisawa's font service and converted to paths, allowing them to be reflected in designs.
  2. Professional standard typefaces and design typefaces loved by designers, such as UD Shin Go, Ryumin, and Gothic MB101, can be used.


Character attribute settings

  1. In addition to font selection, you can also adjust simple typography settings such as character spacing and proportionality
  2. It also has a vertical writing function (beta version), which supports typography for vertical videos such as reels.


Collaboration through text path creation and restoration

  1. The software is equipped with a function that converts text into paths in SVG format. It is possible to restore the text that has been converted into paths in Figma to its original state, which supports flexible design changes and sharing, and accelerates collaboration.
  2. The exported materials can also be used in other design tools and platforms.

plugins.name: Figma to JSON
plugins.description:
This minimalist plugin allows you to:

  1. Copy local page styles including text styles, colours and grid systems to your clipboard.
  2. Copy the selected node tree, including sizings, positions and content of children.


The main intent is to feed your favourite LLM with it, to ease integration automation.

plugins.name: Pikaso
plugins.description:
Determining the colours can be the most challenging thing to start a project, especially a project that begins only based on the logo provided by the client.


We believe that projects that start earlier will result in more explorable findings.


With current technology we can access the colour data on the picture. Combine that with simple and yet powerful AI algorithm to extract the right accurate colours.


With Pikaso, we hope that it can be a solution for everyone to start something faster and more efficiently. Please, feel free to give feedback and comment! We'd like to hear from you all!


Buy Me a Coffee: https://www.buymeacoffee.com/terimakasih

Saweria: https://saweria.co/terimakasihh

plugins.name: Geometric Pattern Generator (Bauhaus Style)
plugins.description: The Geometric Pattern Generator plugin for Figma allows designers to effortlessly create stunning geometric patterns in the BAUHAUS Style within frames or groups. With flexible customization options, users can adjust grid size, density, and colors to generate unique designs. Choose from random color palettes or define custom colors, and use intuitive sliders to control pattern density. The plugin also offers the option to dynamically add, delete, and modify custom colors with ease. Perfect for creating decorative backgrounds, visual design elements, and more, all while maintaining full creative control.
plugins.tagline: Create customizable geometric patterns with random or user-defined colors.

plugins.name: Color Blindness Simulator
plugins.description:
A powerful tool that simulates different types of color vision deficiencies directly in Figma. Perfect for ensuring your designs are accessible to everyone.


Features:

‚Ä¢ Simulates 7 types of color vision deficiencies:

- Protanopia (Red-blind)

- Deuteranopia (Green-blind)

- Tritanopia (Blue-blind)

- Protanomaly (Red-weak)

- Deuteranomaly (Green-weak)

- Tritanomaly (Blue-weak)

- Achromatopsia (Complete color blindness)


How to use:

1. Select any frame, component, or group in your design

2. Choose the type of color blindness you want to simulate

3. Click 'Simulate' to generate a new frame showing how your design appears to people with that color vision deficiency


The plugin creates a new frame next to your selection, making it easy to compare the original and simulated versions side by side.


Based on scientifically accurate color transformation matrices, providing realistic simulations that match medical research standards.


Support: https://buymeacoffee.com/ganeshshenoy


Note: Works with any frame, component, group, or rectangle containing visual elements.

accepted.name: Ganesh Shenoy
accepted.description:
UX Designer @Designit. HMU on 
ganeshshenoys@gmail.com

Plugin & Widget creation fueled by coffee. ‚Äî https://buymeacoffee.com/ganeshshenoy

plugins.tagline: Test your designs across the color vision spectrum

plugins.name: Tokens to Tailwind CSS
plugins.description:
This plugin generates utility classes for Tailwind CSS from design tokens set in the local style of Figma.


Instructions

  1. Create a local styles.
  2. Run this plugin.
  3. Select some options and press generate button.
  4. Copy and paste the generated code into the Tailwind CSS configuration file.


*Currently only colour styles are supported.


Options

„ÉªPrimitive colours

Generates the primitive styles referenced by the semantic style as CSS variables.


„ÉªClassify by keys

Classify by key if a special name is used for the first level of the style name.


Find out more:

https://github.com/K-shigehito/figma-tokens-to-tailwind#readme
plugins.tagline: Generate utility classes for Tailwind CSS from local style of Figma.

plugins.name: Bloq: Create, edit, and renew new/existing design systems
plugins.description:
üé® What is Bloq?


Bloq is a Figma plugin that revolutionizes how design systems are created and maintained.


It offers three major capabilities:

1. Generate an Entire Design System from Scratch

‚Ä¢ Get customized color palettes, typography, border radii, spacing, margins, and a fully variablized component kit ready to use.

‚Ä¢ Perfectly Integrates with the figma ecosystem and industry standard nomenclature.


2. Fix Existing Files or Frames

‚Ä¢ Automatically detect and assign brand guideline values to every component in your file.

‚Ä¢ Choose to fix specific modules, such as a selected screen or an entire page, according to your needs.


3. Create and Enhance Components

‚Ä¢ Scan entire pages to detect all major components, resulting in a new component kit made from the screens on the page.

‚Ä¢ Get all possible variants and states of components generated, with properties automatically assigned to their respective elements.



üò´ The Problem


Creating and maintaining design systems is painful:

‚Ä¢ Manually creating variables for colors, typography, and spacing takes hours.

‚Ä¢ Ensuring consistency across existing designs is tedious and error-prone.

‚Ä¢ Updating old files to match new brand guidelines is a nightmare.

‚Ä¢ Building component libraries and design kit from scratch requires weeks of work.



‚ú® The Solution


Bloq automates the entire process:

1. Input: Pick a figma file and run Bloq on it.

2. Analyze: Our AI examines your design patterns.

3. Generate: Get a complete, variablized component kit in minutes.

4. Update: Modify existing designs with one click.

5. Enhance: Generate complete component sets with variants automatically detected.



üî• Key Features


‚Ä¢ üé® Smart Color Palette Detection: Supports neutral and accent colors.

‚Ä¢ üìù Intelligent Typography System: Automatic style clustering.

‚Ä¢ üìè Automated Spacing & Border Radius Detection

‚Ä¢ üîÑ Bulk Update Capability for Existing Designs

‚Ä¢ ‚ö° Comprehensive Component Kits: Includes variants and component sets.

‚Ä¢ üéØ Flexible Fix Options: Fix a single frame or an entire page.



üí™ Perfect For


‚Ä¢ Design Teams: Launching new brands effortlessly.

‚Ä¢ Agencies: Managing multiple client design systems with ease.

‚Ä¢ Companies: Modernizing design infrastructure without hassle.

‚Ä¢ Time-Savers: Anyone looking to save hours on design system creation.

‚Ä¢ Efficient Creators: Building component libraries and kits without grunt work.



Ready to revolutionize your design workflow? Try Bloq today and experience the future of design system creation!
plugins.tagline: Create or fix the design systems in your files.

Rapidly and incrementally sculpt your unstructured ideas into logical, coherent foundations upon which great ideas can take root.


Getting started


Diagrammaton currently requires an OpenAI API key and a free license code from diagrammaton.com


  1. Sign up for an OpenAI account and generate a key ‚Äî here‚Äôs a guide
  2. Create a Diagrammaton account and generate a license code (requires Google sign-in)
  3. Run the plugin and paste your license code
  4. Create your first diagram!


Most diagrams have a common starting point. Here are some examples to get you started:

  • "An auth flow for a native mobile app that has OTP code verification, 2 factor, and optional biometric auth"
  • "A sign-up process that includes email verification, and profile setup"
  • "A typical mobile app sign in flow"
  • "A change management process for a design team working on a design system in Figma"



üëâ Read the Diagrammaton guide to learn more about the plugin and upcoming features

plugins.name: PWA Icons And Splash Generator
plugins.description:
"PWA Icons and Splash Generator" is a versatile Figma plugin designed to simplify the process of creating Progressive Web App (PWA) icons and splash screens. With this powerful tool at your disposal, you can effortlessly generate all the necessary assets required to make your web application visually appealing, responsive, and ready for a wide range of devices.

Key Features:

  • Icon and Splash Screen Variations: The plugin allows you to generate a variety of icon sizes and splash screens, catering to different screen resolutions and device dimensions. It includes standard sizes commonly used for PWAs.
  • Custom Background Color: You have the flexibility to define a custom background color for your splash screens, ensuring they seamlessly match your app's branding and design.

Whether you're a seasoned web developer or a designer looking to streamline your PWA design process, this plugin empowers you to create a polished and professional user experience by simplifying the generation of icons and splash screens. It's an invaluable addition to your Figma toolkit for PWA design and development.
plugins.tagline: Generate Icons And Splash screen

plugins.name: Define
plugins.description:
Define takes a single layer/group/frame/component/instance, finds out what it contains and gives you the specs for all supported objects it finds. While Define works on complex objects with many nested layers, it works best if you use it to Define individual components.


Currently it reports the following specs:

  • Text layers: font family, size, line height, color and opacity
  • Shapes: corner radius, fill color, stroke color, stroke width, stroke alignment and opacity
  • Effects: drop shadow

plugins.name: Print Resizer
plugins.description:
This plugin collects all components from frames in the current figma page and then copies and rearranges them into new printable frames. The printable frames can then be exported and printed on regular letter head. This plugin is especially helpful for frames with auto-layout since they can only scale in only one direction, making printing difficult.


Visit github for more information on how to use the plugin, how to report issues, and how to suggest further improvements.

17389.name: Print Resizer
17389.description:

The printable frames can then be exported and printed on regular letter head. This plugin is especially helpful for frames with auto-layout since they can only scale in only one direction, making printing difficult.


Visit github for more information on how to use the plugin, how to report issues, and how to suggest further improvements.

plugins.name: Localize
plugins.description:
Localize Your Figma Designs in Minutes


Let your designs speak for themselves. Effortlessly translate your Figma creations into other languages.


Showcase your designs in front of the largest audience possible. Localize seamlessly integrates with Figma allowing you to amplify your work‚Äôs impact by making it accessible to more people and languages.


Unlike run-of-the-mill translators, Localize offers designers an easy and elegant solution that:


  1. Takes the hassle out of internationalization (i18n) and localization (l10n) processes
  2. Automates and streamlines localization workflows right in the design phase
  3. Reduces content translation complexities by eliminating the need for development resources
  4. Maximizes ROI by speeding up time to market


Localize empowers you to create globally-inclusive UI and UX designs, expanding the appeal and reach of your work by presenting them in the languages of your target markets.


Localization as easy as 1, 2, 3


  1. Install Plugin. Go to the Community section on Figma‚Äôs website. Select Plugins and use the search functionality to locate Localize. Select Install on the top-right corner of the Localize plugin page.
  2. Connecting to Localize. Once installed, access Localize via the Plugins dropdown.
  3. Enter your API Key. Start a Localize free trial or integrate with your Localize Business plan (or higher) by entering the API key.


I already have a Localize Advanced plan or higher account:


  1. Install the Localize plugin in Figma.
  2. Open your Figma file.
  3. Hover over Plugins in the toolbar. Select Localize.
  4. Type in your Localize API key. Select Connect.


I don‚Äôt have a Localize account yet:


  1. Install the Localize plugin in Figma.
  2. Open your Figma file.
  3. Hover over Plugins in the toolbar. Select Localize.
  4. Click the Start Your Free Trial link on the bottom of the login view.
  5. Create a Localize account and follow the Localize install steps.
  6. Return to Figma and type in your Localize API key. Then, select Connect.


If your organization doesn't have an Advanced plan, please click to upgrade your plan!


Need help?


For more information and to learn how to install the plugin, visit our Help Docs


Don‚Äôt have a Localize account? Try it for free!
plugins.tagline: Localize Your Figma Designs in Minutes

138077.release_notes:
This update focuses on improving the performance when managing complex designs.

Features:
- Introduced a new toggle within the settings to disable crawling hidden layers. This defaults to allowing crawling all layers to retain the previous behavior. This can be useful for large designs that are contained in a single file, containing thousands of layers.
- Added a new refresh button to the page list to allow crawling your designs on demand, caching the results to improve the plugins responsiveness.

Fixes:
- Improved the performance of the Push To Localize feature, now 26% faster than the previous version
- Optimized the logic for the Pull Translations feature for large, complex designs. This feature should no longer cause Figma to freeze or crash.
- Fixes the icons in the plugin
138077.tagline: Localize Your Figma Designs in Minutes

plugins.name: CorelDRAW.to.design ‚Äî by ‚Äπdiv‚Ä∫RIOTS ‚Äî Import CorelDRAW files (.cdr) to Figma
plugins.description:
Import your CorelDRAW files as fully editable Figma designs.

Go directly from CorelDRAW to Figma and convert any .cdr file into Figma layers!


How to import CorelDRAW files into Figma:

  1. Run this Figma plugin, corelDRAW.to.design
  2. Upload your .cdr file, or drag-and-drop it into the plugin
  3. Click ‚ÄúImport‚Äù
  4. Your CorelDRAW graphics will be imported into Figma as fully-editable layers or high-res images!


Why use corelDRAW.to.design?

  1. Go directly from CorelDRAW to Figma - no additional converter tools required.
  2. Fast, high-quality conversion from CorelDRAW .cdr to Figma, while keeping your designs precise.
  3. Perfect for migrating between tools or using old files for new designs!


FREE

  1. 5 imports/month


PRO License

  1. Unlimited imports

  3. $49 for 1-year (not recurring) or $99 for 3-years (not recurring)

plugins.name: VRT
plugins.description:
Easily track changes across your entire Figma file and avoid accidentally breaking something.


Step 1: Snapshot your current file

The first thing you'll want to do is set your baseline. This will go through all of your pages and create snapshot images for each of them. If your file has many pages, you can select or deselect individual pages.


Step 2: Go make some changes

Once you've got your baseline snapshots set, go forth and make some changes. For example, you may be curious what will happen if you change a specific color. When you're finished, click 'Take Snapshot'


Step 3: Compare Results

At a glance, pages that have any visually noticeable changes will be shown as failed. The baseline snapshot is compared against the comparision snapshot to produce a diff image. Any changes will be marked red.


------------------------------------


Completely open source.

There are 335 icons included in this icon library, all of which can be searched through and added to your designs.

Plugin features:

  • Click any icon to add it your design
  • View search history

plugins.name: Color wheel
plugins.description:
A color wheel is a circular representation of colors, typically made up of 12 hues. It's a fundamental tool in many fields like art, design, and printing, as it helps us understand how colors relate to each other.


RYB (Red, Yellow, Blue): This is the traditional painters' color wheel used for mixing physical paints.


RGB (Red, Green, Blue): This is the color model used for displays like TVs and computer screens.


CMYK (Cyan, Magenta, Yellow, Black): This is the color model used for printing.

plugins.name: Tangent
plugins.description:
Are you looking for a way to create stunning logos with the golden ratio? Do you want to snap and tangent circles and lines with precision and ease? If so, you need to try this plugin for Figma. This plugin allows you to draw and adjust circles and lines that follow the golden ratio, a mathematical proportion that is found in nature and art. You can also create tangent circles and lines that touch each other at a single point, creating a harmonious and balanced design. With this plugin, you can unleash your creativity and design logos that stand out from the crowd. Try it today and see the difference!


If you enjoy using this plugin and want to support its development, you can buy me a coffee. Your donation will help me to keep improving this plugin and adding new features. I appreciate your generosity and feedback. Thank you for choosing this plugin!

plugins.name: Text Visual Alignment
plugins.description:
When working with typography in Figma you often have to manually move text layers and align them to the grid or ruler. This happens because of glyph sidebearings which create huge ‚Äúwhite holes‚Äù. It gets even worse if you have two text layers of different sizes. In this case the ‚Äúholes‚Äù become much more visible.


Our plugin compensates for the sidebearings and works with layers in two ways. Strict Alignment moves the text layer to the first visible pixel. It can be useful when you work with a group of single-line text layers. Optically Correct Alignment moves the layer to the sidebearing value of a straight glyph stem (Latin n/u, Cyrillic –Ω). You can use this option for multi-line layers, especially when the text is set in small sizes.
plugins.tagline: Quickly compensate for sidebearings in text layers to align them perfectly
